data.text: @bobkopp the sadder thing is that when Omicron was looming in December (and on the radar) many people were not mitigating (eg crowding restaurants). We know how to mitigate and need to (ALL) do it when the threat is high, not 24x7x365.  Covid is now endemic.

@bobkopp I am okay with relaxed rules now, as are most people. We are heading to about 5/day. For context, heart disease about 50/day, unintentional injury, 15/day in NJ.  https://t.co/pYTpoW4FkD  Until another major variant of concern, people want to get back to a more normal life

@bobkopp Yup, not happy. Especially as Princeton U is following the lead of the politicians, even while their own COVID dashboard says we are at a medium-to-high risk level where additional mitigation measures are needed.
R in Middlesex County has basically been at 1.0 for the last two weeks -- it's like people have just decided where we are is absolutely fine
